intro: Heterocarpaea texana, commonly known as the Texas heterocarp, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its unique seed structure, known as a heterocarp, is a key botanical feature that aids in its identification.
